thread.title: Watertown field hockey team is one win away from a national record - Local news
thread.title_full: Watertown field hockey team is one win away from a national record - Local news

author: boston.com
title: Watertown field hockey team is one win away from a national record - Local news
text:
It must be hard for Watertown’s high school field hockey team to keep their minds on their studies today.
That’s because if the Watertown Raiders win Wednesday’s game against Melrose High School, it will break a national record and make history. The Raiders have won 153 games in a row, a six-year winning streak.
Related Link Get today’s headlines right in your inbox “It’s very surreal,” Michaela Antonelllis, a senior captain, told CBS Boston . “Every single girl who’s played in this program for the last six years, we’re representing them too.”
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below The team is led by Eileen Donahue, who has been the team’s coach for the past 30 years. The game will take place in Watertown at 3:45 p.m.
